body:
### Problem

Consider this directory structure:
```
test
|   fileA.txt
|
+---subdir1
|       fileB.txt
|
\---subdir2
        fileC.txt
```
When a path in `&path` contains forward slashes and double stars, such as `$HOME/test/**`, `:find`'s tab completion should return all the elements inside the `test` directory when it is invoked on an empty string. Instead, only `fileB.txt` and `fileC.txt` are returned. Keep in mind that `shellslash` is disabled. Vim, on the other hand, suggests every item successfully.

### Steps to reproduce

1. `nvim --clean`
2. `set shell=pwsh`
3. `set path=$HOME/test/**`
4. `:find <Tab>`

### Expected behavior

`fileA.txt`, `subdir1`, `subdir2`, `fileB.txt`, `fileC.txt` should be returned.

### Neovim version (nvim -v)

NVIM v0.9.2
Build type: RelWithDebInfo
LuaJIT 2.1.1694082368
Compilation: C:/Program Files (x86)/Microsoft Visual Studio/2019/Enterprise/VC/Tools/MSVC/14.29.30133/bin/Hostx64/x64/cl.exe /MD /Zi /O2 /Ob1  -W3 -wd4311 -wd4146 -DUNIT_TESTING -D_CRT_SECURE_NO_WARNINGS -D_CRT_NONSTDC_NO_DEPRECATE -D_WIN32_WINNT=0x0602 -DMSWIN -DINCLUDE_GENERATED_DECLARATIONS -ID:/a/neovim/neovim/.deps/usr/include/luajit-2.1 -ID:/a/neovim/neovim/.deps/usr/include -ID:/a/neovim/neovim/.deps/usr/include -ID:/a/neovim/neovim/build/src/nvim/auto -ID:/a/neovim/neovim/build/include -ID:/a/neovim/neovim/build/cmake.config -ID:/a/neovim/neovim/src -ID:/a/neovim/neovim/.deps/usr/include -ID:/a/neovim/neovim/.deps/usr/include -ID:/a/neovim/neovim/.deps/usr/include -ID:/a/neovim/neovim/.deps/usr/include -ID:/a/neovim/neovim/.deps/usr/include -ID:/a/neovim/neovim/.deps/usr/include -ID:/a/neovim/neovim/.deps/usr/include

   file vimrc di sistema: "$VIM\sysinit.vim"
         $VIM di riserva: "C:/Program Files (x86)/nvim/share/nvim"

### Vim (not Nvim) behaves the same?

no, Vim 9.0 2026

### Operating system/version

Microsoft Windows 10.0.22621

### Terminal name/version

Windows Terminal 1.18.2822.0

### $TERM environment variable

N/A

### Installation

winget
title: `:find`'s tab completion returns incomplete results if a component of `&path` contains forward slashes on Windows when `shell=pwsh` and `noshellslash`
